p: Several studies reported variable chikungunya symptomatology, i.e., La Reunion outbreak in 2004 showed patients with asymmetrical bilateral polyarthralgia (96%) of the lower (98%) and small joints (75%), asthenia (89%), headache (70%) myalgia (59%) and adenopathy (9%).[ 3, 11] The 2006 CHIKV outbreak in India reported more that 1.4 million people affected whose clinical manifestations included joint pain, headache, abdominal pain, joint swelling, vomiting, rash, and cough.[ 12] Ray et al. (2012) reported different joint pain comorbidity in two Indian cities (i.e., Delhi and Karnataka) with heterogenous incidences of 40% and 85%, respectively.[ 13] CHIKV symptoms reported in other epidemics, such as diarrhea, rhinitis, conjunctival congestion, hepatomegaly, splenomegaly and lymphadenopathy were rarely observed in the India outbreak.[ 13, 14] Comparison of acute clinical symptoms between CHIKV outbreaks in La Reunion, India, Singapore, Malaysia, and other Indian Ocean islands exhibited typical clinic, with fever, arthralgia, headache, and joint compromise (epidemiology data reported high percentages, between 80% to 100%).[ 14, 15]
